snippet: The Air Force cited the “exceptional loyalty” of Francis Gary Powers, who on his return to the United States in 1962 had faced vilification as a “cooperative witness for the Russians.”
abstract: Francis Gary Powers is posthumously awarded a Silver Star, the military's third-highest decoration, by the Air Force; Powers was subjected to 107 days of interrogation, followed by a two-year prison sentence, after his plane was downed in Russia in 1960, and faced considerable criticism when he returned to the United States.
lead_paragraph: The Air Force cited the “exceptional loyalty” of Francis Gary Powers, who on his return to the United States in 1962 had faced vilification as a “cooperative witness for the Russians.”
